title: Al-Ghazali
summary: Al-Ghazali (UK: /ælˈɡɑːzɑːli/,[24] US: /ˌælɡəˈzɑːli, -zæl-/;[25][26] full name أَبُو حَامِدٍ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ ٱلطُّوسِيُّ ٱلْغَزَالِيُّ or ٱلْغَزَّالِيُّ, Abū Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad aṭ-Ṭūsiyy al-Ġaz(z)ālīy; Latinized Algazelus or Algazel; c. 1058 – 19 December 1111), known in Persian-speaking countries as Imam Muhammad-i Ghazali (Persian: امام محمد غزالی), was a Persian[27][28][29] polymath, who was one of the most prominent and influential philosophers, theologians, jurists, logicians and mystics[30][31] of Islam.[32]
